body: Currently gluonnlp requires the pre-release version of mxnet. You can try `pip install --pre --upgrade mxnet`
@Aashit-Sharma let me know if there's still issue. Thanks

Earlier I ran into this issue https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/issues/11911 and then I downgraded by mxnet version to 1.1.0 . After upgrading mxnet again to the solution above you have mentioned @szha  I am getting the the error mentioned @Aashit-Sharma. Following are the logs.

[log.txt](https://github.com/dmlc/gluon-nlp/files/2687980/log.txt)

@vikaskumarjha9 Sorry to hear that it's still happening to you. From the log, it looks like you have both mxnet and mxnet-cu80, and the mxnet-cu80 is of older version. That might be the cause of this issue.

I have removed mxnet library, now I have only mxnet-cu80 version1.1.0 as my CUDA version is 8+. I am getting this error.      

(trans_env) user1@S3:~/transformer_nmt/ready_to_run_transformer$ python train_transformer.py --dataset WMT2014BPE --src_lang en --tgt_lang de --batch_size 2700 --optimizer adam --num_accumulated 16 --lr 2.0 --warmup_steps 4000 --save_dir transformer_en_de_u512 --epochs 30 --gpus 0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7 --scaled --average_start 5 --num_buckets 20 --bucket_scheme exp --bleu 13a --log_interval 10
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "train_transformer.py", line 45, in <module>
    from mxnet import gluon
ImportError: cannot import name 'gluon'

I tried installing gluon package but no help. Also I have gluonnlp-0.5.0.post0 installed, does this work with mxnet-cu80? Pls help.
@vikaskumarjha9 GluonNLP 0.5.0 depends on MXNet 1.3.0+, so in this case you can try `pip install --upgrade mxnet-cu80`.

Thank you for prompt reply, I updated it to 1.3.1 but now I am getting this error again. 
(trans_env) user1@S3:~/transformer_nmt/ready_to_run_transformer$ pip install --upgrade mxnet-cu80

(trans_env) user1@S3:~/transformer_nmt/ready_to_run_transformer$ python train_transformer.py --dataset WMT2014BPE --src_lang en --tgt_lang de --batch_size 2700 --optimizer adam --num_accumulated 16 --lr 2.0 --warmup_steps 4000 --save_dir transformer_en_de_u512 --epochs 30 --gpus 0,1,2,3,4,5,6,7 --scaled --average_start 5 --num_buckets 20 --bucket_scheme exp --bleu 13a --log_interval 10
Illegal instruction (core dumped)

Am I doing something wrong ?

@vikaskumarjha9 I'm guessing this is related to some instruction set support of the runtime environment. Would you mind trying to update this to MXNet's latest nightly build and see if the issue persists? You can achieve it by running `pip install --pre --upgrade mxnet-cu80`.

If the issue persists with the 1.5.0b nightly versions, we will need to take a closer look. In that case, could you download and run [this script](https://github.com/apache/incubator-mxnet/blob/master/tools/diagnose.py), so that we can examine the supported instructions set on your machine?
